docs.lead_paragraph: New Jerseyans who are self-employed or work for small companies are being offered a new form of health insurance that allows them to establish tax-free savings accounts to be used for routine medical expenses. The accounts, known as medical savings accounts, are intended to encourage people to cut down on unnecessary doctor's visits. They provide tax breaks in return for a high deductible.
docs.abstract: New Jerseyans who are self-employed or work for small companies are being offered new form of health insurance that allows them to establish tax-free savings accounts to be used for routine medical expenses (New Jersey Daily Briefing) (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: For 13 years, Eunice M. was a rivet in New York City's vast bureaucratic machine. She worked as a secretary at a municipal agency in lower Manhattan, processing a flow of paperwork that remained constant even as the agency repeatedly changed its name and purpose. Now, sick and unemployed, forced to live with a grown daughter because she has no home of her own, Eunice spends her days slogging through bureaucracy but from the other side. She is awaiting a hearing on whether she qualifies for disability benefits. She hopes to get an apartment in a public housing project.

headline.main: Ex-Secretary Sees Bureaucracy From the Other Side

docs.abstract: Former secretary at municipal agency in lower Manhattan discusses how she has been helped by New York Times Neediest Cases Fund (M)
